raw_response:
Thought: To determine if a number is prime, we can iterate from 2 up to the square root of the given number and check if any of those numbers divide evenly into it. If no divisors are found, the number is prime.

```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1
  
  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).none? { |i| num % i == 0 }
end
```

final_answer( answer: is_prime? )
```
